key_points: Chris Cuomo reportedly launched personal attacks against Fox News' Janice Dean, who criticized his brother, former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo's nursing home COVID-19 policy.
Janice Dean, who lost her in-laws to COVID-19 in nursing homes, blamed Andrew Cuomo's policy for their deaths.
A source claimed Chris Cuomo sought advice on how to target Dean by painting her as a 'far right crazy.'
It is alleged Chris Cuomo participated in discussions on attacking Dean by focusing on her political leanings.
Rich Azzopardi, spokesman for Andrew Cuomo, claimed he had no knowledge of such actions.
Reports suggest Chris Cuomo and Cuomo aide Melissa DeRosa strategized on discrediting Dean as a right-wing commentator.
Chris Cuomo was fired from CNN following a new sexual misconduct allegation.
The sexual misconduct incident reportedly occurred at ABC News, prior to the allegation leading to Cuomo's CNN firing.
Cuomo had been suspended from CNN after it was revealed he offered extensive help to his brother's team amid sexual misconduct allegations against the governor.
Cuomo allegedly used his media connections to gather information on his brother's accusers.
